Description: Upper body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; glaze fired red; exterior: wide glazek band above horse (head, mane, bridle and rein with dots in added white remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Winged horses on Clazomenian vases from the Knipovitch Class are usually depicted facing right. Those on vases from the Mykonos KE.990 Group are all depicted facing left.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 136, no. 1)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, no. 12, pl. XIX, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.133) (phase 3)
